subject: Re: [PATCH v9 00/19] DCD: Add support for Dynamic Capacity Devices (DCD)

reviews.author: Ira Weiny (author)
reviews.summary: Ira Weiny raised concerns about the implementation of Dynamic Capacity Devices (DCD) in the patch series, specifically pointing out that devices which optionally support DCD are configured via mailbox commands and that Linux has no support for more than one dynamic capacity partition.

reviews.author: Jonathan Cameron
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about unclear behavior of cxl_verify_dcd_cmds() and suggested adding a comment to clarify its purpose. Additionally, he expressed his thoughts on how Dynamic Capacity Devices (DCD) should be presented to VMs, suggesting that it's not necessary to assume virtio and instead focus on providing a handle for memmapping.

reviews.author: Fan Ni
reviews.summary: Reviewer Fan Ni raised two main concerns: (1) a test case where creating a DC region and then a DAX device failed, indicating an issue with resource presentation before probe; (2) questions about how the start dpa of the first region is set and how extents are provided to hosts without dpa gaps.

reviews.author: Alison Schofield
reviews.summary: The reviewer pointed out a dev_dbg() message format string error, specifically that the fourth argument should be a pointer to struct range*, not a double pointer.

reviews.author: Dan Williams
reviews.summary: Dan Williams raised concerns about the readiness of DCD for upstream merge, citing lack of customer pull-through and insufficient communication between platform firmware and Linux expectations.

reviews.author: Davidlohr Bueso
reviews.summary: Davidlohr Bueso raised several technical concerns about the patch series, specifically suggesting changes to error handling and code optimization.

reviews.author: Gregory Price
reviews.summary: Reviewer Gregory Price raised concerns about the necessity of tags in DCD support, proposing to eliminate sparse-DAX and instead implement per-region-driver policies for managing hot-add/remove events.

reviews.author: Alireza Sanaee
reviews.summary: Alireza Sanaee expressed concerns about the flexibility of memory allocation for developers, suggesting that getting a file descriptor (fd) would provide more control and flexibility than NUMA or DAX.
